page.title: 12SHIPBUILDING-HALL RUSSELL
page.content: Situated on Pocra Quay are the massive sheds of Hall Russell's,Shipbuilders. Always a shipbuilding site it was once famous for manufacturing 'Aberdeen Clippers' in the heydays of sail.Only 800 men are now employed building mainly patrol and fishery protection vessels for the Royal Navy.Although a profitable concern the fate of the yard is uncertain due to Government Policy to sell of the yard.There are fears thet the Government are rushing privitisation of the yard and that it will be sold to the private sector at a 'knockdown' price.The workforce are petitioning the Government to make the retention of shipbuilding a condition of sale.For despite prosperity from oil the traditional industries have declined and there is strong local feeling to try and maintain what is now left of the shipbuilding industry.
